meanings.definition: A person who proclaims or announces something.
meanings.sent1: The town crier, known as the proclaimers, announced the news loudly.
meanings.sent2: The proclaimers at the event made sure everyone knew about the upcoming sale.
meanings.sent3: The proclaimers were so enthusiastic that they accidentally woke up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The proclaimers stood tall like beacons of information in the bustling square.
meanings.sent5: The group of proclaimers wore colorful hats to stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: The act of proclaiming or announcing something.
meanings.sent1: The loud proclaimers of the parade could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The official proclamation was made with great pomp and circumstance by the proclaimers.
meanings.sent3: The proclaimers of the new rule did a little dance to make it more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The echo of the proclaimers' voices lingered in the empty hall.
meanings.sent5: The bright banners added a festive touch to the proclaimers' announcement.
